Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

This blend offers a dynamic range of allium flavours from a single source. The Common Chives provide fine, hollow leaves with a gentle, onion-like sharpness. The Garlic Chives contribute flat, solid blades with a distinctly stronger, more savory garlic aroma and flavor. Together, they create a complex, layered taste that is more interesting than either alone.

2. The All-Purpose Allium Boost

This blend is the ultimate “finishing” herb, designed to be sprinkled over dishes just before serving to retain its delicate flavour and vibrant colour.

  • Eggs & Dairy: A classic pairing. Stirred into soft-scrambled eggs, omelettes, or folded into cream cheese, sour cream, and butter.
  • Salads & Soups: Provides a fresh, sharp counterpoint to green salads, potato salads, and as a garnish for creamy soups like vichyssoise.
  • Asian Stir-fries & Dumplings: The garlic chive component is essential for dishes like Jiaozi (dumplings) and stir-fries, where its robust flavour stands up to high heat better than common chives.
  • Universal Garnish: A handful snipped over grilled meats, roasted vegetables, or pasta adds an instant lift of fresh, savoury complexity.
3. The Harvest and Yield

Both varieties in the blend are “cut-and-come-again” perennials. Harvest by snipping leaves about 2 cm from the base, which encourages new growth from the center. Supplied as a combined RFID seed pad, it provides a continuous, mixed yield of 15–30g of fresh chives per week, even in lower light conditions.
